result.execSummary:
The defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:42 AM Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen in court, in custody.   Attorney Renee M Taber in court ( 21CF403, 21CM257).  Attorney Gabriel Pollak in court (22CF55, 21CF160, 22CF41).  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls all case listed and recites appearances.  Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.  State recites agreement including all cases, all parties agree.  State gives explanation on agreement, Court accepts explanation.  Attny Pollak agrees,  Attny Taber makes statement.   

21CF160:  Court reviews information and DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1.   DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 1, and finds DEF guilty to  Count 1.   Count 2 is dismissed and read in.  

21CF403:  State requests court to amend information 961.41(3g)(am) - Possession of Narcotic Drugs.   Court grants motion to amended information.   DEF enters NC Plea.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to amended Count 1, and finds DEF guilty to amended Count 1.   

22CF55:  Court reviews information and DEF enters NC Plea to Count  2.   DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 2, and finds DEF guilty to  Count 1.   Count 1, 3, and 4 are dismissed and read in.  

22CF41: Court reviews information and DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1.   DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 1, and finds DEF guilty to  Count 1.   

21CM257:  Case is dismissed and read in.


State makes statement prior to sentencing.   Attny Pollak makes statement prior to sentencing.  Attny Taber makes statement prior to sentencing.  DEF reads statement to court.  Court has discussion with DEF, DEF responds.   Court to follow agreement.  

COURT:  
21CF160:  COUNT 1:   6 month County Jail,  Good time and Huber Privileges.  137 days jail credit.  TIME SERVED.   Court costs, includes  DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.  Pay obligation within 30 days or apply for a payment plan within 30 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

21CF403:  Withheld Sentence.  3 years probation.  Conditions of Probation:  Consecutive to 21CF160.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety.  Court Costs, includes DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. 

22CF55:  COUNT 2:  Withheld Sentence:  3 years probation:  Conditions of Probation:  Consecutive to 21CF160.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety.  Court Costs, includes DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. 

22CF41:  Maximum Sentence:  6 years State Prison.   3 years initial confinement.  3 years extended supervision. STAYED -  IMPOSED:  3 years probation.  Conditions of probation:  Consecutive to 21CF160.  Complete any counseling and programming deemed appropriate by agent, and follow through.  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Absolute Sobriety.  Court Costs, includes DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge.    If revoked:   DEF is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, and Substance Abuse Program.  

21CM257:  Case is dismissed and read in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:36PM Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen not in court.  Attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak in court for Alyssa Richelle Hollen. Attorney Kenneth Sortedalh appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. Court indicates Atty Pollak wishes to withdraw his motion to suppress, agreement reached, requests PLEAS.  Atty Pollak makes statement, does wish to withdraw motion and has informed DEF.  Court instructs Atty Pollak to contact JA to get a PLEAS scheduled.
Motion hearing on May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION TO SUPPRESS EVIDENCE
Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:58 PM Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Pollak acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea to Count 1 and 2.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.     Attny Pollak makes bond argument for modification.   State objects to bond modification.   Court denies bond modification.  Status conference scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
of Preliminary Hearing Held on March 11, 2022

11:44 AM Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Attny Renee Taber appears by video (represents DEF in Cases 21CF403, 21CM257).  Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Pollak indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State request court to take judicial notice of Sawyer County Case Bond 21CF403.  Attny Pollalk no objection.   Court takes judical notice.   State calls witness, City of Hayward Officer Matthew Anderson, sworn in by court.  State begins examination.   11:47 AM Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness.   11:47 AM Attny Pollak cross-examination.   11:49 AM  State objection - legal argument.  Court over rule objection.  Witness answer question.   Attny Pollak no further questions.   11:50 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Pollak no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2022 at 11:45 am.

08:35 AM Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen in court with attorney Gabriel Andres Pollak.  Defendant Alyssa Richelle Hollen in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.    DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Through counsel DEF enters NG Plea to Counts 2, 3, and 4.   DEF request preliminary hearing within time limits.  Court sets.   Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 11:45 am.
